WebGLShaderPrecisionFormat.summary: The WebGLShaderPrecisionFormat interface is part of the WebGL API and represents the information returned by calling the method.

WebGLShaderPrecisionFormatPrecision.summary: The read-only WebGLShaderPrecisionFormat.precision property returns the number of bits of precision that can be represented.

remarks.para: For integer formats this value is always 0.

WebGLShaderPrecisionFormatRangeMax.summary: The read-only WebGLShaderPrecisionFormat.rangeMax property returns the base 2 log of the absolute value of the maximum value that can be represented.

WebGLShaderPrecisionFormatRangeMin.summary: The read-only WebGLShaderPrecisionFormat.rangeMin property returns the base 2 log of the absolute value of the minimum value that can be represented.
